questions.question: What is the main difference between metals and non-metals?
options: Metals are good conductors of heat and electricity, while non-metals are not.
Metals are usually solid at room temperature, while non-metals can be solid, liquid, or gas.
Metals have high melting points, while non-metals have low melting points.

questions.question: Which of the following is a property of metals?
Which non-metal is essential for respiration?
